lexUnit.name: scowl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an angry or bad-tempered expression.

sentence.text: You would n't think it was possible for a middle-aged department store manager to simply crumple before the withering scowls of his wife .
As he stepped closer to Eisenhower , however , his face took on a more considered expression , a scowl of concentration seeming to split his forehead in two .
The scowl on his face indicated displeasure , and after a moment 's silence she asked , ` Is anything the matter ? "
Lucy noticed the scowl on his face .
His scowl vanished ; he shrugged extravagantly and smiled .
Silas 's scowl remained on his face as they continued to walk along the track .
Ronni folded her arms across her chest and tried to fix a disapproving scowl to her face .
Michele was smiling slightly , but Paul wore a scowl , and it was apparent to Luce that , faced with the other man 's cool sophistication , he felt ill at ease , out of his depth .
Rob gave her an embarrassed scowl .
He gave her a mock-ferocious scowl .
I had a permanent scowl on my face for weeks . "
He kicked the kerb again hard and set his lips in a scowl .
He looks up at me , his brow arched in prurient scowl .
Hayman 's monkey-like face twisted into a vicious scowl just thinking about it .
` Give me a pen , " asked the bully with a scowl .
He received this innocent information with a scowl .
His scowl had deepened , and there was a note of warning his voice .
Richmann 's scowl deepened , but he restrained himself from snapping an answer back at the General .
